III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12206 Staff qualifications; volunteer,
Section contractors on central registry
Description • (2) A staff member must be of responsible character and
suitable and able to meet the needs of children and families
served by the agency.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff member took child to the zoo and sexually molested him.
Staff member told child to get down there and get to licking
referring to her vagina. Staff has lice and she is acting like a
terrorist.
Investigation INTERVIEWS
All of the following interviews were conducted with MDHHS
Worker.
Youth A was interviewed in person at his school on 9/22/2025. He
stated he lives with his grandparents with whom he feels safe. He
identified Foster Care Worker as his current worker. He described
Foster Care Worker as nice and couldn’t identify anything he
didn’t like about her. He stated he has never been alone with
Foster Care Worker. He stated he sees Foster Care Worker along
with another worker every Thursday during his visits with his mom.
He stated the visits are typically at McDonalds, but one time the
visit took place at Applebee’s. He denied having visits with his
mom, Parent A, at any other location. He reported that his
grandmother, Caregiver A, transported him to and from the visits
with his mom and stated he has never been in a car with Foster
Care Worker. He reported having been to zoos twice in his life,
once earlier this summer and once while in Florida. He stated both
times he was with his grandparents. When asked, he reported
knowing body safety and denied anyone touching him
inappropriately. When asked, he denied Foster Care Worker
asking him to lick anything at any time.
Foster Care Worker was interviewed in person at the agency on
9/22/2025. She reported having been assigned to Youth A’s case
since July of 2025. She stated she never took him to the zoo. She
reported the only time she is alone with Youth A is during her
monthly home visits and, even then, she speaks to him in his
bedroom with the door open while Caregiver A is in the next room.
She added she usually has a worker shadowing her during those
visits, so she really isn’t alone with him. Foster Care Worker
reported Parent A’s parenting time with Youth A takes place from
2

4:00-5:00pm at McDonalds. She stated that, last week, Parent A
was not at McDonalds at the visit time, so Foster Care Worker
called her. Parent A did not answer, but she called Foster Care
Worker back then hung up. She then sent a text message to
Foster Care Worker stating she wasn’t going to the visit because
Foster Care Worker is “a pedophile rapist” and because Parent A
is “such a bad person.”
Foster Care Worker reported Parent A recently told her she had
lice, so Foster Care Worker had to tell Parent A’s psychiatrist
Parent A could not attend an appointment. Foster Care Worker
reported to the court Parent A had not completed her
psychological testing and that it was rescheduled. Foster Care
Worker denied having lice herself and she does not know why
Parent A would say she did other than she was mad at her for
telling the court Parent A had lice. Foster Care Worker stated she
doesn’t know if it’s true that Parent A has lice. Foster Care Worker
stated Parent A has mental health issues and has a history of
saying people are breaking into her house trying to give her lice.
Foster Care Supervisor was interviewed in person at the agency
on 9/22/2025. She reported Parent A sent a text message to her
alleging Foster Care Worker sexually molested Youth A at the
zoo. She stated Parent A has multiple mental health diagnoses
and is not taking her medication. Foster Care Supervisor reported
Foster Care Worker has not been to the zoo with Youth A and, as
far as she knew, had never been alone with Youth A. She stated
that, during a recent Family Team Meeting, Parent A stated she is
jealous of Youth A’s bond with Foster Care Worker.
Foster Care Supervisor reported Foster Care Worker has not had
any disciplinary action since working at the agency and there were
no concerns with her ability to perform her job responsibilities. She
reported that since this allegation was received, Foster Care
Worker has not had any contact with Youth A. She stated another
worker will attend all visits with Youth A along with Foster Care
Worker while the investigation is pending.
Caregiver, Youth A’s maternal grandmother with whom he
currently lives, was interviewed by phone on 10/2/2025. She was
not given the details of the allegation but was asked how things
were going with Foster Care Worker. Caregiver described Foster
Care Worker as “young and learning,” but added she has had no
concerns with Foster Care Worker. Caregiver stated Foster Care
Worker has never done anything “off color.” She stated Foster
Care Worker speaks to Youth A alone in his room when she
3

completes her home visits, but Caregiver is in the home and, while
she can’t hear the specifics of what is being talked about, Foster
Care Worker keeps the door open so Caregiver can hear them.
Caregiver added, other than those visits, Foster Care Worker has
never been alone with Youth A. She stated Youth A has never
mentioned anything bad about Foster Care Worker and the only
person she knows that would complain about Foster Care Worker
is Youth A’s mom, Parent A. Caregiver stated Parent A wanted
more time with Youth A, but the court denied her request, so
Parent A is mad at Foster Care Worker.
Parent A- Attempts were made to contact Parent A via phone on
9/22/2025 and 10/2/2025, and by text on 10/2/2025. Additionally,
MDHHS Worker sent a letter to Parent A on 10/10/2025 regarding
attempts to reach her. No responses were received.
DOCUMENTS REVIEWED
• 9/22/2025 safety plan written and signed by Foster Care
Worker and Foster Care Supervisor stating Foster Care
Worker agreed to have a support person with her during
home visits and parenting times involving Youth A while the
investigation is pending.
• Youth A’s case record social work contacts documenting
that Foster Care Worker has conducted three monthly face-
to-face visits with Youth in Caregiver A’s home and two
parenting times between Youth A and Parent A. No other
face-to-face contacts between Youth A and Foster Care
Worker were documented to have occurred.
Analysis The agency is in compliance with staff responsibility requirements
as it pertains to Foster Care Worker’s character and ability to
provide for the needs of youths and families as there is no
evidence to support allegations that she sexually molested Youth
A at a zoo.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
4

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
